parse.title: Billboard Music Award for Top Dance/Electronic Song

text.*:
The Billboard Music Award for Dance/Electronic Song winners and nominees. Eminent winners include LMFAO, MØ, Avicii, and Baauer.

Contents

  • 1 Winners and nominees
  • 2 Most wins and nominations
    • 2.1 Wins
    • 2.2 Nominations
  • 3 References

Winners and nominees[edit]

Two-time winner Baauer
Two-time winner DJ Snake
Two-time winner
The Chainsmokers

2011~2013: Top Dance Song
2013~2013: Top EDM Song
2014~present: Top Dance/Electronic Song

Year Song Artist Nominee R
2011 Stereo Love Edward Maya and Vika Jigulina Lady Gaga-Bad Romance
Lady Gaga featuring Beyonce-Telephone
La Roux-Bulletproof
Yolanda Be Cool and DCUP-We No Speak Americano 		[1]
2012 Party Rock Anthem LMFAO feat. Lauren Bennett and GoonRock Dev-In the Dark
David Guetta feat. Usher-Without You
LMFAO-Sexy And I Know It
Britney Spears-Til the World Ends 		[2]
2013 Harlem Shake Baauer David Guetta feat. Sia-Titanium
Nicki Minaj-Starships
Psy-Gangnam Style
Rihanna-Where Have You Been 		[3]
Calvin Harris-Feel So Close
Calvin Harris featuring Florence Welch-Sweet Nothing
David Guetta featuring Sia-Titanium
Swedish House Mafia featuring John Martin-Don't You Worry Child
2014 Wake Me Up! Avicii Daft Punk feat. Pharrell Williams-Get Lucky
Icona Pop feat. Charli XCX-I Love It
Lady Gaga-Applause
Zedd feat. Clarity-Clarity 		[4]
2015 Turn Down For What DJ Snake and Lil Jon Clean Bandit feat. Jess Glynne-Rather Be>
Disclosure feat. Sam Smith-Latch
Ariana Grande feat. Zedd-Break Free
Calvin Harris-Summer 		[5]
2016 Lean On Major Lazer and DJ Snake feat. MØ The Chainsmokers feat. Rozes-Roses
DJ Snake and AlunaGeorge-You Know You Like It
David Guetta feat. Nicki Minaj, Bebe Rexha, and Afrojack-Hey Mama
Skrillex and Diplo feat. Justin Bieber-Where Are Ü Now 		[6]
2017 "Closer" The Chainsmokers feat. Halsey The Chainsmokers feat. Daya – "Don't Let Me Down"
This Is What You Came For" – Calvin Harris featuring Rihanna
"Cold Water” – Major Lazer featuring Justin Bieber & MØ
"Let Me Love You” – DJ Snake featuring Justin Bieber 		[7]
2018 "Something Just like This" The Chainsmokers feat. Coldplay "No Promises" - Cheat Codes (DJs) feat. Demi Lovato
"Rockabye" – Clean Bandit featuring Sean Paul and Anne-Marie (singer)
"It Ain't Me" – Kygo & Selena Gomez
"Stay" - Zedd & Alessia Cara 		[8]

Most wins and nominations[edit]

Wins[edit]

  • 2 (Baauer, DJ Snake, The Chainsmokers)

Nominations[edit]

  • 4 (The Chainsmokers)
  • 3 (DJ Snake)
  • 2 (Baauer, David Guetta, LMFAO, Nicki Minaj, Zedd)

References[edit]

  1. ^ "2011 Billboard Music Awards". philbrodieband.com. Retrieved November 12, 2016. 
  2. ^ "2012 Billboard Music Awards". Awardsandwinners. Retrieved November 7, 2016. 
  3. ^ "2013 Billboard Music Awards". Awardsandwinners. Retrieved October 15, 2016. 
  4. ^ "2014 Billboard Music Awards". Awardsandwinners. Retrieved October 15, 2016. 
  5. ^ "2015 Billboard Music Awards". Variety. May 17, 2015. Retrieved October 16, 2016. 
  6. ^ "2016 Billboard Music Awards". Billboard.com. May 22, 2016. Retrieved October 16, 2016. 
  7. ^ "2017 Billboard Music Awards". Billboard.com. May 21, 2017. Retrieved June 24, 2017.
